byline.contributor: Sandra E. Garcia and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.
byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and AL BAKER

abstract: New York City Police Dept says city is as safe as it has been in its modern history in 2015, according to reported levels of most serious types of crime; department reports that seven major felonies fell 2 percent, and arrests fell 13 percent through Dec 20; polls, nevertheless, show New Yorkers are anxious about crime, and some have mixed feelings about what some perceive as aggressive policing.
lead_paragraph: Fewer episodes of major crime in New York City in 2015 have made the year the safest in modern history, but William J. Bratton, the police commissioner, has also called it “a year of great contradictions,” as two officers died on duty.

headline.main: Anxiety Aside, New York Sees Drop in Crime
headline.print_headline: Anxiety Aside, New York Sees Crime Decline
